document.heading: Prohibition on Abandoned Vehicles Amendment Act of 2000

history.narrative: Law 13-267, the “Prohibition on Abandoned Vehicles Amendment Act of 2000”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-407, which was referred to the Committee on Public Works and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 8, 2000, and December 5, 2000, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on January 5, 2001, it was assigned Act No. 13-557 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-267 became effective on April 3, 2001.
